text: Très bonnes pâtes et mets Italiens. Le bar a pain est un must!  Bonne ambiance, sauf quand il y a 3+ fêtes pour qui on chante joyeux anniversaire pendant le repas...

Simili tendance avec bar à pain... Bon bèn c'est ça qu'y é ça.  Bouffe correcte mais beaucoup trop chère.  Ça ne vaut pas du tout le prix payé.  C'est comme un fast food italien avec un décor plus à la mode.  Le repas est acceptable et le service est bon mais encore une fois, pas à la hauteur de la facture.  Les kidz font cuire leur pain sur le grill.
Great Pizza! Great service!! I had a great time with the family. Stella Artois draft beer.. Goood times. Overall 5 star for me

Belle petite ambiance. Malheureusement le plat de Tortellini Sauce Rosée que jai reçu était identique à ce que j'aurais pu me faire à la maison.   Côté goût c'était correct mais la présentation laissait à désirer. En entrée j'avais la fondue parmesan; pas impressionné.

I would probably rather die than go back there to eat. Nothing was good, the bread buffet really should be called "sandwich bread" buffet. 3 types of bread and 3 types of spread. Hardly a buffet.  The food was mediocre at best. The service was really subpar.  Husband ordered a dish that said it was made with sundried tomatoes, instead it was made from a sauce made of sundried tomatoes... big difference.  Will not be back!

Pros:  - Since I was a child I have always appreciated their fabulous "all-you-can-eat bread bar". Basically, they have a grill where you can get a bread of your choice from a variety of breads provided and also be able to spread a dip of your choices from a variety provided and toast your bread to your taste in a matter of seconds. Self serve tasty bread.  - No wait, very quiet and plenty of seating available at prime time... or perhaps the cons will state why?  - Prices are honest and fair.   Cons :  - Service was under par. I simply didn't understand why we'd have to wait an extraordinary long amount of time to get our meals. Was it simple laziness? Lack of staff? I cannot tell... but one thing was sure though, when I got my meals, they were barely luke warm, so that speaks volumes.  - I ordered the table hote and got my escargot within 5 minutes. I found this alarmingly fast. Did the cooking staff process our meals immediately or did they simply reheat it in a microwave? They were tasty but more rubbery then they should be. My fiancee's Caesar salad was almost without any dressing.  - For my main meal I ordered "Penne sauce à la viande braisée". When received after close a 45 minute wait, the meal was barely warm and the meat tasted suspect. I didn't finish half of it and simply filled myself with more bread. My fiancee's ordered the "Lasagne fiorentina" and had the same result. It was luke warm and while she expected some spinach inside of it, it was far too much to her liking.   I have a no return food to kitchen policy.  I haven't been to a Pacini's in a few years and this was certainly my first visit to this particular location of this chain. Perhaps it would have been a better experience at another location but I cannot tell as the experience left a bitter taste in my mouth.  Service requires a big improvement in this restaurant.

Gotta agree with Jason on this one.  My Dad suggested we come here. So of course I checked out yelp to see what the score was on this place. After reading the review we changed our mind and chose to go across the street. Upon arrival there St.H was so busy you couldn't even park so we changed our minds and decided to hit this place after all.  Face it we would have been better off driving on and going elsewhere. I guess since the reasonable and fair prices had gone a while back. Since there was hardly a pasta under $20 on the menu. These came with a tiny bowl of not so exciting soup or a crappy looking salad. The all you can eat bread bar was a total pass. I cant believe that an Italian restaurant would pass sandwich bread  as a selling point to their name.  The main course was warm at best. Seems like even though the service was good the kitchen staff are out to sink this what looks like a sinking ship. The portions were less than the over inflated price it summoned.  In my world if you chose to charge that kind of money you better make sure I walk out full or that the ingredients are extravagant.   if your thinking of dining here I advise you to keep driving you'll leave hungry and feel ripped off on the way out.

Je ne vais jamais dans ce type de resto (fast-food italien ou autres) mais on m'avait offert un certificat cadeau de 50 $ et je me suis dit pourquoi pas l'essayer ! Déçue, très déçue de la nourriture qui y est servie. Je ne parle pas de l'accueil qui a été très bien ni du service qui soit dit en passant était excellent mais de la présentation et de la saveur des plats. Nous avons commandé mon conjoint et moi deux plats de pâtes soit, des cannellonis et de la lasagne, plats très représentatifs de la cuisine italienne. Quelle ne fût pas ma surprise lorsque nous avons reçu ces plats d'en voir la présentation, on se serait cru à bord d'un vol d'Air Transat ou autre compagnie, les pâtes étaient présentées dans une barquette de moyenne dimension tout comme si elles avaient été faites à l'avance et surgelées...Et que dire du prix exhorbitant exigé pour de tels plats, tout près de 20 $, on se serait attendu à beaucoup mieux  ! Je suis prête à payer 20 $ pour la lasagne de l'Amarone, rue St-Denis puisque la qualité et le goût sont au rendez-vous mais pas pour un plat qui goûte la can du chef Boyardee. Non, je n'y retournerai pas. Ça s'appelle rire du monde ! Il y avait bien peu de personnes en ce mardi soir par contre, pour les autres restos aux alentours, les stationnements étaient pleins...

Food tastes good but pretty overpriced for what you get. Something I'vent seen before is the bread bar where you can pick your choice among three different breads and spreads. Have a decent wine selection on the menu. Don't go if you are in a hurry or on a budget.
